title: Chat restricted because???
body:
First time here so bear with me.

So i got chat restricted. The story goes like this. I was playing Nasus into Jayce and i fed mega hard because i was tilted and couldn't concentrate, the reason i said that about cait is because she seriously refused to leash our jungler so that's that, then i continued to get one shot early game by Jayce and i didn't know what to do anymore. I wasn't about to give up though, i tried grouping with my team to take him out and we actually fought back pretty damn hard but i digress.

So all i can think of is i got a chat restriction for saying ''yes i fed''
I MEANT FED AS IN YES I DIED FOR NO REASON
But i didn't LITERALLY run it down into the enemy team, i even got commended by a team mate for not giving up and not quiting. And i get this..

replies.body:
Overly critical of your team, constant criticism, asking for reports, calling folks clowns, etc. But I do have some advice to help prevent this in the future:

"Z is cool: can you just play
Z is cool: instead of typing"
Is there nothing like a permanent mute all so i won't forget to mute everyone, if there was that option i'd definitely do it and never talk in chat again, i'm tired of the auto response bot
Disabling chat makes you a liability to your team, especially if they dont know you did it. Disabling pings as well and you are basically trolling at that point.
That's your opinion and you're free to have it. But if it helps him improve his behavior, it's not punishable for disabling it.
It actually is punishable (refusing to communicate), just very rare for it to be.

> It actually is punishable (refusing to communicate), just very rare for it to be.

Yes and no.

Yes in that, refusing to communicate does apply to some certain situations (I.E, massively gameplay-altering off-meta picks, a la CounterJungle Support Singed/Nunu, Mid-Support Teemo, whatever else have you)...

But in this case, which is disabling chat and muting pings, no. That is not punishable. It isn't punishable to mute pings (even if you're muting pings from the get-go), and it isn't punishable to disable/mute chat - in point of fact, I'm pretty sure Riot straight-up added that feature semi-recently (with the Mute Allied Chat feature).

There is, actually. You can go into settings and turn off all chat and team chat. Itll persist for every game afterwards. Only thing it wont mute is pre and post game lobby chat. You can also mute emotes.
What about pings though, do those still come through?
They still come through. Youll have to mute those manually in the Tab screen.
Honestly, this is something i'll never turn on again. Allied and all chat, i'm tired of seeing trolls in my game.

I always have those disabled. My games are 10x better without it. Then at post screen, I report normally for trolling or if my team seemed to have an overwhelming problem with one player's negativity they could see in chat. I think if you make this small change, you will find league much more enjoyable.
